title.narrative: IR 2.2 QUALITE DE L'EDUCATION

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 2.2: By the end of 2018, the learning results in reading and mathematics from first to 3rd grade and in life skills from first to sixth grade improves for at least 70% of pupils and the primary gross rate of completion increases from 56% in 2010 to at least 85 % in 2017, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNIVERSAL QUALITY BASIC EDUCATIONPCR 2: By the end of 2018, universal access to education, and a significant and fair increase in completion of quality primary education, supported by a life-cycle approach, will be provided to children.

related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/002 ÉDUCATION PRIMAIRE DE QUALITE POUR TOUS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.2: By the end of 2018, the learning results in reading and mathematics from first to 3rd grade and in life skills fromfirst to sixth grade improves for at least 70% of pupils and the primary gross rate of completion increases from 56% in 2010 to atleast 85 % in 2017

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the capacity building of 916 (82 women) headmasters and school inspectors and 75,266 teachers on reading, math and life skills through a cost-effective close supervision and school network approach, that allowed a higher coverage of trainees to implement the curricular reform for the use of the four national languages (Lingala, Swahili, Tshiluba, Kikongo). 154,822 students (77,275 girls) received individual education/early learning materials. To avoid duplication and inequitable breakdown between provinces, UNICEF provided support to the Global Partnership for Education (GPE) funded project PAQUE to prepare the distribution of learning materials all over the country. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
